artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Keikaen Keika; Publisher: Akiyama Buemon; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 516; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 306, p. 300.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: three separate sheets; portrait of a scowling man with long face and bulging eyes, wearing a small black cap with braided white tie, black garment with gold characters, and undergarment of lavender with large predominately green, red and yellow floral medallions; man holds his PR arm out to his side, holding a green scroll in his hand; four white pompons on the front of his garment; dark blue ground
dimension: 14 1/2 × 9 3/4 in. (36.83 × 24.77 cm) (sheet, each, approx., vertical ōban triptych)
inscription: 花の香も/露けきものよ／旅び衣 {Hana no ka mo / tsuyukeki mono yo / tabigoromo}
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳年之印 {Yoshitoshi no in} | Carver’s seal: 彫勇 {hori Yū} | Seal below his name reads 人間萬事 {Ningen banji}.
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
text: Ichikawa Danjūrō IX as Benkei in the play Kanjinchō. Poem by Keikaen Keika.
title: Ichikawa Danjūrō IX
